metadata.title: CVE-2019-13376 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
phpBB version 3.2.7 allows the stealing of an Administration Control Panelsession id by leveraging CSRF in the Remote Avatar feature. The CSRF TokenHijacking leads to stored XSS

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13376` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

phpbb3 - 3.0.12-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
phpbb3-l10n - 3.0.12-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: phpbb3 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.0.12-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
